DOC.brief_summary: BACKGROUND In 2008 approximately 7,700 total knee arthroplasty ( TKA ) perform Denmark . The result TKA general good , investigator , however , discover patient follow fast-track TKA still deficit 12 month postoperatively 5-10 % health-related quality-of-life 15-20 % activity participation compare age- gender match population . A postoperative rehabilitation intervention potential reduce remove observed deficit . The current evidence postoperative rehabilitation TKA , however , scare conflict , study show lasting effect beyond 3 month postoperatively . PURPOSE The purpose study investigate 6-weeks postoperative rehabilitation intervention effective supervise home training , furthermore investigate cost-effectiveness intervention societal perspective . MATERIALS & METHODS The study perform randomized clinical trial . In total 140 patient include study . Inclusion criterion age 18 year , patient diagnose knee arthrosis , patient receive primary elective TKA , patient able willing transport rehabilitation center , demand ability walk 50 meter , climb 10 stair step . Exclusion criterion unicompartmental revision arthroplasty , neurological disease , knee infection , substantial pain functional limitation hinder rehabilitation test physiotherapist prior rehabilitation start . Primary endpoint 6 month postoperatively primary outcome measure change total score use knee specific questionnaire Oxford Knee Score .
